column3:
Suggestion: rename the function to `SetupEnvironment`, always call it, and make it a no-op for windows for now.

N.B. the reason for this, no need to do it in this pull request, but I think some stuff that we now do at the beginning of AppInit2 would also fit better in a `SetupEnvironment` function:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/init.cpp#L395

This builds & works on my machine with libboost 1.55 - this error from Jenkins is related to the libboost version rather than the function itself ?

```
util.cpp: In function void SetupEnvironment():
util.cpp:1412: error: codecvt is not a member of boost::filesystem::path
```
I believe pulltester build environment has an older boost, with perhaps\nboost filesystem v2 instead of v3, which is only partially compatible.\n

In that case, surround it with:

```
#if BOOST_FILESYSTEM_VERSION >= 3
```
that commit seems to do a lot of not really related things. Are you sure you didn't accidentially include more changes than intended here?\n

Am trying to do a new clean commit now with just the changes for the
function.

On 05/13/2014 10:42 AM, leofidus wrote:

> that commit seems to do a lot of not really related things. Are you
> sure you didn't accidentially include more changes than intended here?
> 
> â€”

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5248ff40997c64cc0fde7aaa67cf94dd38b14899 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Please define this function in the appropriate header, in this case util.h.\n

Move the #ifndef WIN32 to inside the function. Then we can also use it for other OSes.

BTW: I suppose `src/test/test_bitcoin.cpp` and `src/qt/test/test_main.cpp` need this too?
